oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Surrender of Lord Cornwallis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Engraving entitled "Surrender of Lord Cornwallis". The engraving depicts Cornwallis' sword being surrendered to Washington by three British officers. Washington and three of his men stand ready to accept with the American flag flying behind them. Grouping of tents can also be seen behind the group of officers while soldiers are shown in formation in the background.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Campaigns & battles; Surrenders; Battlefields; Art
Cornwallis, Charles Cornwallis, Marquis, 1738-1805
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: British General Charles Cornwallis' surrender at Yorktown on October 19, 1781, effectively ended the Revolutionary War.
